verse:
इन्द्रियेभ्यः परा ह्यर्था अर्थेभ्यश्च परं मनः।
मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्बुद्धेरात्मा महान्परः ॥
meaning: इन्द्रियेभ्यः परा ह्यर्था अर्थेभ्यश्च परं मनः।मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्बुद्धेरात्मा महान्परः ॥indriyebhyaḥ parā hyarthā arthebhyaścha paraṁ manaḥ।manasastu parā buddhirbuddherātmā mahānparaḥ ॥Meaning:The objects of perception are higher than the senses, and the mind is higher than the objects. But the intellect is higher than the mind, and the self/soul is greater than the intellect, being the supreme and beyond.Overall meaning:

upanishad-org.meaning: Than the senses the objects of sense are higher: and higher than the objects of sense is the Mind: and higher than the Mind is the faculty of knowledge: and than that the Great Self higher.
